subject: Technology
title: Chinese Smartphone Giants
description: A 60-second lesson on Chinese Smartphone Giants.

hook.text: In 2010, Chinese phone brands were unknown outside Asia. Today they outsell Apple in most of the world.

buildup.text: Xiaomi, Oppo, and Huawei offered flagship-quality specs at half the price of Samsung or Apple.

discovery.text: Xiaomi sold phones almost at cost and made money from software services and accessories instead.

twist.text: The U.S. banned Huawei from using Google services, cutting it off from Western markets overnight.

climax.text: Despite bans, Chinese brands dominate Africa, India, and Southeast Asia. Price wins in most markets.

punchline.text: Affordable phones conquered the markets that premium brands ignored.

quiz.question: How did Chinese smartphone brands gain market share?
options: By offering flagship specs at much lower prices
